title: Kuala Lumpur Stadium
text:
The Kuala Lumpur Stadium or KLFA Stadium () is a <a href="multi-purpose%20stadium">multi-purpose stadium</a> in <a href="Kuala%20Lumpur">Kuala Lumpur</a>, Malaysia. It is currently used mostly for <a href="Association%20football">football</a> matches and is the home stadium of <a href="Kuala%20Lumpur%20City%20F.C.">Kuala Lumpur City</a>.
Background.
In the past, the stadium was used as the home ground of many Malaysian teams, including <a href="Felda%20United%20F.C.">Felda United</a>, <a href="PDRM%20FA">PDRM</a>, <a href="PLUS%20FC">PLUS</a>, <a href="Selangor%20FA">Selangor</a>, <a href="UKM%20F.C.">UKM FC</a>, and <a href="Royal%20Malaysia%20Police%20F.C.">Royal Malaysia Police</a>. The stadium has been closed in July 2011 due to the City Hall's reluctance to renovate the pitch. Starting in 2012, the stadium has also been used for <a href="Rugby%20Union">rugby</a> matches. It was used for the first match of the 2013 Media Prima 6 Regions, between Kelab Rakan Muda Malaysia and <a href="Singapore%20Cricket%20Club">Singapore Cricket Club</a>. Between 2013 and 2018, the stadium was renovated; after the renovation, the stadium has a capacity for 18,000 spectators.
Transport.
The stadium is accessed by <a href="Rapid%20KL">Rapid KL</a> bus T402 to <a href="Taman%20Midah%20MRT%20station">Taman Midah MRT Station</a> on the <a href="Kajang%20Line">Kajang Line</a>, and T400 to Sri Kota flats just outside <a href="Bandar%20Tun%20Razak%20LRT%20station">Bandar Tun Razak LRT station</a> on the <a href="Sri%20Petaling%20Line">Sri Petaling Line</a>.
